This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=COMPLEXITY.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2014-11-17T12:34:59Z Peter Johnson 2014-11-17T12:34:50+00:00 2014-11-17T12:34:50+00:00 Policy Modelling in Practice Workshop https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;ba9f7a6b.1411 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;ba9f7a6b.1411">Policy Modelling in Practice Workshop </a> Peter Johnson 2014-10-24T09:27:02+00:00 2014-10-24T09:27:02+00:00 REMINDER: Call for Participation: Policy Modelling Workshop. CRESS, London, 8th December 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;a85b8a30.1410 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;a85b8a30.1410">REMINDER: Call for Participation: Policy Modelling Workshop. CRESS, London, 8th December 2014 </a> Greg Fisher 2014-09-15T19:32:10+02:00 2014-09-15T19:32:10+02:00 Non Equilibrium Social Science Conference: 28 October. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;86d9deb9.1409 Dear Colleague,<br><br>I am emailing to invite you to join a conference on 28 October hosted by NESS (Non-Equilibrium Social Science), which is a three year EU research programme. NESS began life at the end of 2011 in order to build ideas about new ways of thinking regarding how the economy and society operate.<br>NESS is holding a one day policy-oriented conference in London on 28th October, where we will be drawing out practical implications in key areas such as: [...] Nigel Gilbert 2014-08-23T10:13:20+00:00 2014-08-23T10:13:20+00:00 Call for Participation: Policy Modelling Workshop. CRESS, London, 8th December 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;f5288bd8.1408 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;f5288bd8.1408">Call for Participation: Policy Modelling Workshop. CRESS, London, 8th December 2014 </a> Ozge Dilaver 2014-06-04T15:08:34+00:00 2014-06-04T15:08:34+00:00 Third Constructed Complexities Workshop https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;9df008b3.1406 ?<br><br>Third Workshop of the Constructed Complexities Series:<br>Research methods for investigating complexity of social construction<br>12 June 2014 - Lecture Theatre B<br>University of Surrey?<br>In this workshop, we are aiming to reflect the state-of-the-art in modelling social complexity with a thematic focus oninstitutions.<br>Previous Constructed Complexities workshops covered three types of institutions: institutions as organisations, rules and norms and shared habits of thought. Models of institutions in the existing literature mainly focused on common-pool resources and generally took institutions as rules. At the same time, due to conceptual connections between the second and third types of institutions, some [...] Alison Cooper 2014-06-03T19:36:13+01:00 2014-06-03T19:36:13+01:00 Role of Social Media in Science Policy? - Guardian Blog Event https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;b8740bbf.1406 List members might be interested in this event. The Complexity Science for the Real World Network Twitter Account is still active @Complexsci, we are monitoring its use in promoting engagement between research and policy.<br><br>Alison Cooper<br>Complexity Science for the Real World Network Coordinator<br><br>Marsh, Oliver oliver.marsh.13@ucl.ac.uk via jiscmail.ac.uk<br><br>16:19 (3 hours ago)<br><br>to PSCI-COM [...] Alison Cooper 2014-06-03T08:42:26+01:00 2014-06-03T08:42:26+01:00 End of Network Online Survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;87ae4fe0.1406 The Complexity Science for the Real World Network ends on 12th June 2014. Please complete this survey about our online engagement. The outcome will help the four projects with their remaining activities and inform future initiatives.<br><br>The survey will close on Monday 9th June 2014.<br><br>https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/RSDLHS6<br><br>Thanks very much<br><br>Alison Cooper<br>Complexity Science for the Real World Coordinator Bruce Edmonds 2014-05-16T13:42:48+01:00 2014-05-16T13:42:48+01:00 Sub list for those around manchester https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;9ad59cc0.1405 If you live near enough manchester there is another JISC list called<br>manchester-complexity@jiscmail.ac.uk for complexity notices/events relevant<br>to complexity science in manchester.<br><br>To subscribe or look at archives see:<br>http://jiscmail.ac.uk/manchester-complexity<br><br>Regards. Alison Cooper 2014-05-07T08:18:17+01:00 2014-05-07T08:18:17+01:00 Workshop on use of probabilistic forecasts - Royal Statistical Society - 19 June 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COMPLEXITY;6278234a.1405 The main aim of the workshop is to bring together both academics and practitioners of probabilistic population forecasting to discuss barriers to the uses of probabilistic forecasts and possible ways to overcome them. A second aim is to learn from the best practice in other areas of application of probabilistic forecasting. [...]
